definition: to appear personally/to step in/to step forth/to show up

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: Like before, government officials will speak to boost market sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 像以前一样，政府官员会出面安慰市场情绪。

sentences.english: Shimizu is her bodyguard and will move in if there are problems.
sentences.chinese: 清水是她的保镖，一旦出现问题，便由他出面解决。

sentences.english: More promising may be mooted government support for credit insurance.
sentences.chinese: 一个更有前景的措施是政府出面提供贷款信用保证。

sentences.english: He has been asked to adjudicate in the disagreement between the city council and the citizens.
sentences.chinese: 请他出面仲裁市议会和市民之间的分歧。

sentences.english: Perhaps there was still time to intervene in behalf of that man.
sentences.chinese: 可能还来得及由他出面说一下情？

sentences.english: Liverpool FC's chairman Martin Broughton and managing director Christian Purslow were also in the High Court.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部主席布劳顿和总经理帕斯洛同样在高法出面。

sentences.english: Trade talks are to be held by nongovernmental organizations of both sides.
sentences.chinese: 双方由民间团体出面商谈贸易。

sentences.english: The United States is now best placed to secure an accord.
sentences.chinese: 现在是美国出面让双方达成协议的最佳时机。

sentences.english: If our country loves its people, it should stand up for them.
sentences.chinese: 如果国家是爱人民的，它应该为他们出面。

sentences.english: By a party or by the multi-party appear to lead a society.
sentences.chinese: 由某个政党或由多党出面来领导一个社会。

sentences.english: The doubters, in fact, have already come forward.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，持怀疑观点的人已经出面放话了。

sentences.english: Finally, a female investigator from the Ministry of Justice saved the day.
sentences.chinese: 最后法务部一位女调查官出面解救这个困境。

sentences.english: Then the Chinese government intervened and banned on-site butchery.
sentences.chinese: 后来，中国政府出面干预并禁止了现场屠杀。

sentences.english: Cong ex-boyfriend Jiang Dawei, said he is willing to accept the plexus.
sentences.chinese: 丛前男友姜大伟出面，表示自己愿意接纳丛。

sentences.english: She hoped that the length of one school can come forward to stop Dr.
sentences.chinese: 她希望一校之长的胡博士能出面制止。

sentences.english: Disclosure matters, the three "heavyweights" have come forward to explain.
sentences.chinese: 事情披露后，三位“重量级人物”纷纷出面解释。

definition: to intercede/to plead for sb else
to get involved in/to meddle/interference
to set out (on a campaign)/to stand for election/to throw one's cap in the ring
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
to be fair/to be impartial/to settle (a matter etc)
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
to negotiate (with)/to have dealings (with)
to mediate (a conflict etc)
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
to inspire/to incite
see 作主[zuo4 zhu3]
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
intermediary/mediator
to persuade/persuasion/to advise
to sb's face/in sb's presence
